comments.commentBody:
First it was "Little Marco."
Then it was "Lyin' Ted."
Now it's "The Indian."
Donald Trump seems to be running for kindergarten class president rather than president of the United States. No wonder the Republican Party is torn asunder.

Trump doesn't understand that women like Warren have a lot more experience dealing with men like him than he does dealing with women like her.
So far, he's been able to ignore or get rid of women he doesn't like in his professional life. She hasn't had the same luxury.

Elizabeth Warren has so many talents! And her Twitter abilities are second to none. In her, DT has met his match. She will reduce him to a quivering mass of jelly before this year is over.

Her strategy and Twitter tactics are likely to derail the donald over and over. Because he simply cannot let go of a need to attack, when a well-known individual launches a volley in his direction.

I begin to think this guy is very weak on Focus. He gets derailed so easily. Loses his cool under fire. And simply can't stop himself. It's another clear indication why he is totally unfit for the presidency. He can't be bothered to study up on the issues, but he gets derailed in Twitter feud?

He is no match for Elizabeth Warren! Kudos to her!

Senator Warren will continue to dismantle The Donald, as will other Democrats, where his Republican opponents failed, because they have both the spine and the moral compass to do so.  Even the few GOP figures who won't endorse Trump, like Senator Graham, cite insipid reasons, like not passing the conservative purity test.  How about because Trump is ignorant, immature and incendiary?  Lead the charge, Elizabeth!

Go Liz! It's about time someone stood up to this guy in an adult way. You can't just stand there and let him bully but you can' take the dialogue down to the gutter. I just want to take a shower ever time I even think about him.

Lizzie Warren took her Twitter axe
And gave poor Donald Trump 40 whacks
When she saw how successful her tact had become
She gave him another deserved forty-one!

Good for Elizabeth Warren, attacking the real-estate developer/empty headed huckster from the left flank. Now we need military strength attacking from the right flank, starting with Senator McCain denouncing the huckster and giving an ultimatum in his demand for a total apology to McCain and the U.S. military. Make him get down on his hands and bone spur feet when he does.

Glad to see that Elizabeth Warren is taking up the fight against Donald Trump and giving him a taste of his own medicine. I expect Trump is so uninformed that he doesn't understand the degree to which Warren has been fighting for the middle class. By attacking her he's also attacking the efforts to protect the middle class from predatory business practices. That might make the GOP establishment happier with him but it will leave him vulnerable to attack on working class issues. Either way Trump jumps, he loses. Warren is opening up a good wedge issue.

Unlike Trump, who has neither courage nor convictions, Elizabeth Warren has the courage of her convictions.  She took a bold, politically risky position by breaking with President Obama on the Pacific Trade agreement.  And she didn't use empty rhetoric, she specified her concern for American workers in the deal.  Trump never goes deeper than accusations of "terrible deals" and promises of making "good deals."  Warren is the one to take on Trump, word for word.

Yes, go Elizabeth go!  Toss those tweets to the Bully Twitterwit, the Manhattan Mudslinger, Bilious Billionaire, Deport 'Em Donald, Pompous Populist, Nattering Narcissist, Debt Defaulter, Bankrupt Bore, Offensive Oligarch, Sewage Slinger ... Well, you get the idea.  Now we, Bernie backers, absolutely need you to convince Hillary to become a true progressive and top it off by putting you on the ticket as Vice President.  Only you can really Trump Trump!

If she can pull the Bernie crowd enthusiastically into the Hillary camp that would be adequate to probably assure Hill's victory- and that will be tricky enough, judging from the vitriol towards Hillary coming from Bernie's internet following.

He's been working 24-7 to convince people Hillary is a sell-out to Wall St. who supported NAFTA. I have found it shocking to read his young followers writing about her as if she's some kind of monster.

Maybe Liz can explain that much of the compromise and lack of adequate government action to help the middle class (and students coming out of college) has mostly to do with the Democratic voters themselves, who always fail to show up in the mid-terms. Without a cooperative congress there isn't much a president can do.

Unfortunately calling Donald all the things he is--racist, sexist, xenophobic--doesn't really land much of a punch. Where is he personally weak and ridiculous? Those are the targets to aim for. Something essential about his persona that makes him silly. Not sure what would hit the mark. Best is something that contradicts his own image of himself. That's why calling him a "loser" has a lot of power. That's the last thing he wants to be. Keep calling him and his ideas losers. Then offer up an better ways to help the middle class.

Senator Warren, Brava!!
You have a strong economic message pointing out the injustice faced by the 99% and the rampant power and corruption of Wall St. institutions. But you have also demonstrated crystal clarity of thought recognizing Donald Trump and everything he stands for as the real threat to our nation. This is even more important at a time when many have let their vision be so clouded by a dislike for Hillary Clinton that they cannot recognize Trump as the disgraceful enemy of the state that he is. Keep up the good fight. You are a beacon of light!

It is priceless watching this highly energetic, knowledgeable, intelligent woman tear into this bellicose, bloviating bully who is so far out of his league and out of his depth.  I believe that her decision to defer making an endorsement so far was quite politically savvy on her part.  It will carry far more clout when it comes at just the right time.  I have no doubt that Hillary will be the nominee, and that Sen. Warren will endorse her.  This will help bring many disappointed Bernie supporters along (although some of the more strident among them will predictably attack and demean their former heroine).  Thank you Elizabeth Warren.  What a breath of fresh air.

Trump's stink about whether Elizabeth Warren is of Native American ancestry is pointless. Sen. Warren's anecdotal claim to Cherokee heritage is all that many Americans with indigenous genetics have. Blacks did not own the patent or have the market cornered on racial discrimination in latter half of the 19th and early 20th centuries. In the years of Warren's grandparents, great- and great-great grandparents denial of Indian parentage was quite commonplace. Family oral histories for myself, if they are factual, put me somewhere between 7/32 and 3/8 Native ancestry, with all 4 of my grandparents handing down the DNA. No governmental level documentation has been found, however, to substantiate our belief or claim.

Record keeping among those of little means was hardly systematic, and reliability standards were not what we have today. Innumerable marriages were without any form of documentation, be it a license, certificate, or other written proof. DNA testing can shed some light on the presence of indigenous ancestry, but without being able to distinguish between tribes.

Regardless of whether she is 1/32 Cherokee or none at all, her ancestry as an American citizen, from the standpoint of the amount of time her family has been on this continent, puts Donald Trump's to shame.

Sic'im, Liz!

I'm certainly not a fan of Trump - and his candidacy is evidence of how sorry the state of our country has become in many regards. We have a faux democracy that limits voting access - a government (of either party) that doesn't work for the common good or in the interests of its citizens - wars in various countries that apparently the president can now declare without Congress - a media that strenuously tries to
slant the election on the course they want it to go - the list is endless.

And now we have two adults - one an important Senator - the other the Republican presidential nominee having a Twitter war? Really? Sure, if forced to take a side, I'd be with Warren - but frankly I find all this just further evidence of the decline of this country and the level of discourse. Certainly, we can assign blame to Trump who started it - and then we can all go play with our blocks and have story time.

And all the commenters who eagerly jump on board to say "You go Liz" just makes me feel sad and further disillusioned.

As the quotes goes, "I would challenge you to a battle of wits but see that you are unarmed." I'm not sure that Donald Trump is constitutionally able to win against intelligent women - either Elizabeth Warren or Hillary Clinton. His crude attempts to characterize women by their "disgusting" bodily functions or their 1-to-10 scale plastic surgery appearances suggest a deep insecurity about women or misogyny. Trump's mother was a Scottish-born philanthropist but he seems to take after his father more, the man who was arrested for violence at a KKK rally and who faced charges as a racist landlord.

Warren is exactly right though. He is a bully.

I am a liberal Democrat and sympathise with Elizabeth Warren on many issues, but these tweets of hers are not much better than Trump's.  This is not politics about issues but about name calling.  If this is leadership, then the United States is in pathetic shape.  The difference between a tweet and leadership can be seen by contrasting even the best of these with Obama's inspiring oratory at Howard University the other day.

Elizabeth Warren might make a great "attack dog," but it makes little political sense to pick a running mate from a state that won't even be in play for Republicans. If Hillary gets the nomination, she should be looking for a Veep from a swing state, such as North Carolina, Ohio, Colorado, or Florida. (Possibly Nevada).

Can't win an election without Ohio. We know that much from history.

Elizabeth Warren is bright, honest and ethical and wants to help the 99%. Hilary has the same values, and the experience to be the President. A female First Lady, and a female Vice President would be awesome!   It would show an adult  and informed electorate that had made a wise choice. Lets get with it!

As a Bernie Sanders supporter, I was at first disappointed that Elizabeth Warren did not come out and endorse Bernie, since their views appear to correspond closely. But I now think that she read the tea leaves brilliantly.

Too bad that some Democrats (surely only the Clinton diehards) were irked by her not endorsing Hillary, but I believe that she is now better placed than any other leading Democrat - and, especially, far better than Debbie Wassermann-Schultz, the DNC's woefully inadequate chairperson - to be a trusted bridge between Bernie's and Hillary's supporters, both at the convention and thereafter.

We don't know if Elizabeth Warren is auditioning for the VP attack dog role or not, but she is certainly sullying her reputation in the process.  She stoops too low to trade tweets with the Donald. The baseness of this election cycle is truly depressing. I would have hoped that a woman with Elizabeth Warren's intelligence and stature would have elevated the dialogue rather than jumped in head first.
Senator Warren -- PLEASE stop this Twitter claptrap and preserve your dignity.

A lot of wishful thinking in the NYT article and the Editor's pick comments about the fall of Trump at the hands of Warren.  Warren excites the hard core anti-Trump crowd but her twitter attack will not garner more opposition to Trump among the undecided.

Senator Warren is too late to influence me. She would not support Senator Sanders when she had the chance.

She need not fear that Sanders voters will support Donald Trump in November We won't! But neither will we support Secretary Clinton in the November general election.

We will also remember Senator Warren's inaction for Senstor Sanders in future elections.

This is about which side are you on Senator Warren. By supporting Secretary Clinton, and not Senator Sanders, Senator Warren is signaling she is on the side of the Oligopoly and not the people.
